subject: Unicode proposal, yet again.
msgSnippet: Hi, Found the will to live again, it was behind the sofa along with a biro and 24 pence in various small coins. :) I ve put together a table which shows the
messageBody:
Hi,

Found the will to live again, it was behind the sofa along with a biro
and 24 pence in various small coins. :)

I've put together a table which shows the relationships of glyphs and
sounds between Quikscript and Shavian.
It's in the schemes directory under the name quik_shaw.html.

There are two properties of each character we care about, what it
soundsLike and what it LooksLike.
A Quikscript character looksLike a Shavian character if a font maker
could use the same glyph for both.
A Quikscript character soundsLike a Shavian character if they are read
out loud the same.

Where both of these properties are the same we can merge the Quikscript
and Shavian characters with out losing the meaning of either (at least
that's the theory).

I've put question marks next to the matches I'm not sure about.
The glyphs for foot/wool and ooze/ooze are similar, but the Shavian
versions seem to be more pointed, I'm not certain if that's just the
font used on the Unicode code chart or if they're meant to be that way.
Fee/thigh has a similar problem, I'm fairly sure that the stoke in
Shavian Letter Thigh is meant to cross itself, but the code chart
doesn't actually show this.

Anyway there are probably other issues with the chart, please let me
know if you spot them so I can make the corrections.
